definition: drop in elevation/(fig.) gap (in wages, expectations etc)/disparity
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]

sentences.english: The gap is even larger with India, which is also growing fast.
sentences.chinese: 这比值的落差在印度更大，虽然印度也发展迅速。
一条壮观的瀑布，落差50米。

sentences.english: Watch your step – the elevator car may not be perfectly level with the floor.
sentences.chinese: 注意脚下，电梯轿厢可能与地板有落差。

sentences.english: About 2 meters height, we are tring to figure out how to use Low Head generator with terraced field. Crazy, right?
sentences.chinese: 落差两公尺，研究使用低水头水力发电机的可行性。

sentences.english: The history of the painting reflects a huge drop of times.
sentences.chinese: 户县农民画的沉浮变迁映现了时代的巨大落差。

sentences.english: In limerick, near river drops about 33 meters, has a big hydropower station.
sentences.chinese: 在利默里克左近，河流落差达33米，建有大水电站。

definition: (fig.) gulf/chasm/wide gap/(originally) the Hong Canal in Henan, which in ancient times formed the border between enemies Chu 楚 and Han 漢|汉
to move up and down/to undulate/ups and downs
fault (geology)/CL:道[dao4],個|个[ge4]/(fig.) gap/rupture (in the transmission of some skill)/(tomography) cross-sectional
drop of height in waterway/staircase of waterfalls
